Tapi::StateMachineOut Class Reference

Simple state machine output. Just asks for all available states once and then prints information about the current state. More...

Detailed Description

Simple state machine output. Just asks for all available states once and then prints information about the current state.

Author
Tobias Holst
Version
1.2.1

Tapi::StateMachineOut::StateMachineOut ( ros::NodeHandle *  nh)

Member Function Documentation

void Tapi::StateMachineOut::current ( const std_msgs::String::ConstPtr &  msg)
private

Called by a ros callback when a new current state has been got. Then it prints information about the current state on the console.

Parameters
msgThe message waiting in the ros message queue where the current state is stored.

Definition at line 71 of file statemachineout.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

ros::ServiceClient** Tapi::StateMachineOut::client
private

Doublepointer to a ros::ServiceClient to call the GetStateMachine service.

Warning
Has to be dereferenced once at first. Then check it whether its a null pointer. If not it can be used by dereferencing it twice. If it's a null pointer when dereferencing once it means there is no connetion to a ros::ServiceServer.
